meanings.definition: To make a sharp, high-pitched bark or yelp.
meanings.sent1: The small dog would yorp whenever someone knocked on the door.
meanings.sent2: The puppy likes to yorp when it sees a squirrel in the yard.
meanings.sent3: The yorp from the puppy startled the sleeping cat.
meanings.sent4: The sudden yorp of the alarm clock woke me up from my deep sleep.
meanings.sent5: The yorp echoed through the quiet forest, alerting the other animals.

meanings.definition: A sharp, high-pitched bark or yelp.
meanings.sent1: The yorp of the small dog caught everyone's attention in the park.
meanings.sent2: The yorp of the puppy was so loud that it startled the birds nearby.
meanings.sent3: The yorp of the little dog sounded like a tiny trumpet playing a tune.
meanings.sent4: The yorp of the squirrel made the other animals in the forest pause.
meanings.sent5: The yorp of the puppy was like a musical note in the quiet evening.
